file_content.text: I've recovered a shipment of weapons for the research outpost.
Excellent! We lost almost everything in the last attack. This is a stroke of good fortune.
We'll deal with the rest of the Gormak. Thank you again for everything.
The Gormak leaders are dead. Hopefully they have the intelligence to retreat and regroup.
The Gormak leaders are dead. You can deal with the rest.
Thank you, my lord. I promise you, we won't waste the opportunity you've given us.
My part's done. The rest of the Gormak are all yours.
You're better than an entire squadron. Thank you, hunter.
Attack when ready, Commander. The Gormak leaders won't bother you.
Excellent work! Thank you! I'll make sure Imperial Command hears of your part in this.
I'll mobilize these worthless Voss and my remaining men and see if we can't mop up any of the beasts still lurking nearby.
I'll prepare my troops to attack on your go-ahead.
We've been plagued with complications from the start of this mission. And the Voss are not helping.
Things are starting to look up; you're the first people I've seen in days who weren't Voss.
My lord, I'd welcome you to the research outpost if these idiot Voss had managed to hold on to it.
You're a welcome sight, hunter. I was afraid our reinforcements would be more Voss.
It's nice to see someone from civilized space again. I'm sick to death of Voss.
It is so good to see someone who's not a blasted Voss!
I can't imagine why we're courting an alliance with these freaks. They can't spit without a prophecy telling them when and where.
The Gormak struck while we were helping to build the research station. The unfinished defenses were rubbish, and we only had a few men. We had to fall back here.
You let yourself be overrun by savages? What kind of officer are you?
That's pathetic.
The Gormak savages are far more resourceful than the Voss. Though that's not saying much.
Do you have enough men left to hold this position?
How many survived the attack?
Short answer: no.
Let me handle the Gormak.
My lord, you honor us.
Killing Gormak might be fun.
Ah... thank you, my lord. That's very kind.
I can clean up your Gormak.
I'm glad to see a professional show up out here.
I could try to help out.
Thank you. We're in dire need of some experienced fighters out here.
The attack cost me most of the men who could tell which end of the blaster went first.
The Gormak leaders are the dangerous ones. If you eliminate them, I can lead what's left of my men to clear the rest.
Wait here, I'll return when the leaders are dead.
Very well.
I like a plan with action.
I'm deeply in your debt. I'll be waiting for you to give the all-clear.
Any grunt could do that.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
Of course. I'm sorry to have wasted your time.
My lord, thank you. You've saved my men from the hopeless incompetence of the Voss.
Well done! Thank you, hunter. With only the idiot natives searching for them, I considered these hopelessly lost.
Where did you find these? Well done! The blasted Voss can't locate their backsides with both hands.
We're under fire by the Gormak almost constantly. Fresh weapons will make all the difference to us.
I thought this was a research outpost. It looks like a refugee camp.
Why defend this dump?
How long have you been under attack? Where's your support?
There should be guards here.
You're welcome.
Where are our reinforcements? I'm growing sick of listening to these Voss whine.
